critique: The document is an approval of a code of fair competition. The tone is formal and legalistic. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and stability in the economy. There is a sense of joy that the code has been approved and that it will help the industry. There is a sense of sadness that the industry needs help. There is a sense of fear that the industry will not be able to recover. There is a sense of disgust that the industry has been unfair. There is a sense of surprise that the industry has been able to survive.
